title: Harmonic Echo ignores damage taken multipliers
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.1.0 PTR Build 38312

**Description:**
> The damage done by the AoE component of Harmonic Echo ignores any damage taken multipliers present on the target. In particular, if the target with Radiant Spark debuff does not have any damage reduction and a nearby target does, this bug allows the legendary to bypass the damage reduction entirely.

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Find two targets, one of which has a large damage reduction. Cast Radiant Spark on the normal target and trigger Harmonic Echo. Observe that the secondary target (with the damage reduction) takes full damage.

title: Harmonic Echo can hit the wrong targets
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.1.0 PTR Build 38312

**Description:**
> Harmonic Echo excludes the target from 5 it selects with the smallest GUID instead of the target that Harmonic echo triggered on.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/115239737-4a9d3c80-a0dc-11eb-8814-c2f90134b0a5.png)
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/115239796-5a1c8580-a0dc-11eb-89da-94fb0079b5a4.png)
> The GUIDs of the five targets, the yellow star is first.
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/115240337-e333bc80-a0dc-11eb-9be2-e23e9c63a488.png)

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Equip the Harmonic Echo legendary, cast Radiant Spark on a target with at least one other nearby target, and observe which targets get hit. Repeat with Radiant Spark on another target in the group.

title: Harmonic Echo does not trigger on the 4th stack of Radiant Spark Vulnerability
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.1.0 PTR Build 38312

**Description:**
> When using the Harmonic Echo legendary, the bonus damage does not trigger from damage that consumes the 4th stack of Radiant Spark Vulnerability.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/115233866-a7492900-a0d5-11eb-8881-aded52df4d5e.png)

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Equip the Harmonic Echo legendary, cast Radiant Spark on a target, and cast spells into the target until the 4th stack of Radiant Spark Vulnerability is removed. Harmonic Echo will only be triggered three times, as it fails to trigger on the last spell.

title: Radiant Spark does not work properly with multiple Mages
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 live Build 38134

**Description:**
> Radiant Spark Vulnerability is reset for all Mages when the stacks are reset for one of them.

**Details:**
> When Radiant Spark Vulnerability's 4th stack is used, the debuff is removed and the Mage is no longer able to generate new stacks. If multiple Mages have Radiant Spark Vulnerability present on a target, then the debuff will be removed for all Mages at once when this happens. Mages other than the one that consumed their 4th stack will be able to generate new Radiant Spark Vulnerability stacks.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/FX9tgW4AqL8JdCm7/#fight=3&view=events&type=summary&pins=2%24Off%24%23244F4B%24expression%24(%20ability.name%3D%22Radiant%20Spark%22%20or%20ability.name%3D%22Radiant%20Spark%20Vulnerability%22%20)%20and%20rawDamage%3D0%20or%20ability.name%3D%22Ice%20Lance%22%20or%20ability.name%3D%22Arcane%20Missiles%22

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Have one Mage use Radiant Spark on a target and gain at least one stack of Radian Spark Vulnerability. Have another Mage then consume their 4th stack of Radiant Spark Vulnerability. Both debuffs will be removed.

title: Unholy Assault GCD isn't reduced by haste
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.1 PTR + Live

**Description:**
> Unholy Assault global cooldown isn't affected by haste.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39236684/114972860-31e01d00-9e77-11eb-8c49-8a596121ed47.png)

**Reproducible:**
> Yes

**Howto:**
> Very obvious with high haste/bloodlust, or use ```/run GCDE=GCDE or CreateFrame('FRAME', 'GCDE');GCDE:RegisterEvent('UNIT_SPELLCAST_SUCCEEDED');GCDE:SetScript('OnEvent', function (_,_,_,_,id) print(select(1,GetSpellInfo(id))..":",(select(2,GetSpellCooldown(id)))*1000);end);``` script in game

title: Carver's Eye (Heirmir Soulbind Trait, Necrolord) does not work if you 'overkill'
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.1.0 PTR Build 38312

**Description:**
> The Carver's Eye buff will not proc if you kill a target in a single hit, or if the initial hit causes the target to drop below 90%.


**Reproducible:**
> Yes

**Howto:**
> Any easy to kill NPC will be sufficient to showcase this. Ensure you have Carver's Eye trait selected, and use an attack or ability that will deal more than 10% of the targets maximum health, causing it to drop below 90% on your first hit.

title: Carver's Eye (Heirmir soulbind trait, Necrolord) does not seem to trigger from AoE, Non-DoT attacks
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.1.0 PTR Build 38312

**Description:**
> Carver's Eye (Heirmir soulbind trait, Necrolord) does not seem to trigger from AoE, Non-DoT attacks. This was tested with the rogue abilities Blade Flurry, Fan of Knives, Blade Rush and Shuriken Storm. It may apply to virtually any AoE attacks that rely on a primary target, have not tested other classes yet.


**Reproducible:**
> Yes

**Howto:**
> Ensure you have activated Carver's eye on Heirmir's soulbind tree and find any group of target dummies you so choose. For rogues, any AoE attacks that don't apply a DoT have resulted in no procs of Carver's eye.

title: Cloaked in Shadows (Rogue Endurance Conduit) - Shield size is not increased by 50% as patch notes state
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.1.0 PTR Build 38312

**Description:**
> the recent changes to Cloaked in Shadows are only partially active. The shield drops after 4 seconds and does not decay (Despite buff tooltip still saying it will), however the shield size has not been buffed by 50% as the 9.1.0 PTR Notes suggest.

**Reproducible:**
> Yes

**Howto:**
> Equip Cloaked in Shadows conduit. Enter Stealth. Observe shield size in comparison to 9.0.5 version of the conduit

title: Shadow Blades does not increase CP generation of Serrated Bone Spike
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 live Build 38134

**Description:**
> Shadow Blades does not increase combo point generation of Serrated Bone Spike by 1, despite being a combo point generator. It also does not cause Shadow Blades damage. This is inconsistent with the other two covenant abilities that generate combo points.

**Details:**
> Despite being a combo point generator, Shadow Blades does not affect Serrated Bone Spike. It does work on both Sepsis and Echoing Reprimand, however, both dealing the extra shadow damage and generating 1 additional combo point. (For some reason, the Sepsis tooltip doesn't update to show 2 CP will be generated, but it does generate 2. Echoing Reprimand updates correctly.)


**Reproducible:**
> Yes

**Howto:**
> Cast Shadow blades, Cast Serrated Bone Spike on a single target repeatedly. Only 2 CP will be generated repeatedly.

title: Sunfire is not included in the spec aura for Restoration Druids
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 live Build 38134

**Description:**
> Both Sunfire and Moonfire have the same instant and periodic coefficient which are both reduced by 20% for Restoration Druids with the class aura (effect 8 and 9 for direct and periodic). For some reason Sunfire isn't included in the 25% buff to literally every other damage ability a Restoration Druid can use meaning Sunfire is doing another 20% less damage than it would do otherwise.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> In game log showing Sunfire ticking 36% lower than Moonfire:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15235603/113180763-676af080-9251-11eb-9ff5-a0789a7c1a1e.png)

**Howto:**
> Spec into Restoration as a Druid and look the tooltip or log for Moonfire+Sunfire

title: Cheat Death damage reduction not working reliably
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 live Build 37899

**Description:**
There seem to be cases where the damage reduction after proccing Cheat Death is not applied consistently to incoming damage, which can cause the talent to fail in achieving its goal of... well, cheating death. As to why that is or how to reproduce it, not entirely sure.

Example showing mitigation not being applied by Push
![Example](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/266712108861751296/819860093095903232/a7d5ff5e9bdc73a59e8235d0989896e1.png)

title: Phoenix Flames does not deal damage if the target leaves line of sight before it impacts
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 live Build 37899

**Description:**
> Phoenix Flames does not deal damage if the target leaves line of sight before it impacts.

**Details:**
> The impact of Phoenix Flames (id=257541) triggers a second spell that actually does damage (id=257542). This second spell is still cast by the Mage and currently requires line of sight, which can prevent it from properly casting.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=46Ng_Myp0bI

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Cast Phoenix Flames on a target and move out of line of sight before it impacts. This is easiest to do with Alter Time.

title: Flagellation still on Shadow Blades whitelist causing display bug
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 live Build 37864

**Description:**
Minor display bug (for now until this is forgotten and causes unexpected surprises). Flagellation is still on the whitelist of one Shadow Blades effect. This one effectively causes the tooltip of Flagellation to change to say 2% Haste instead of 1% while Shadow Blades are up. No practical effect.

Screenshot provided by Whispyr
![Bug](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/266712108861751296/819371838848368690/unknown.png)

title: Shadowfiend/Mindbender pet modifier does not update fast enough after entering Voidform
body:
**Game Version:**
9.0.5 live Build 37864

**Description:**
When using Mindbender or Shadowfiend, if you cast it before entering Voidform it does not pickup the Voidform modifier until a few seconds (roughly 3 seconds) after you actually used Voidform. This causes any damage from the pet to be exactly 5% behind where it should be for the first few seconds of Voidform (includes melee swings and Shadowflame Prism).

**Details:**
Mindbender/Shadowfiend do not update their modifier fast enough when the player changes their damage state (i.e. Voidform). This causes the damage to be inaccurate if Mindbender is cast outside of Voidform for a few seconds. If Mindbender is cast inside of Voidform this bug is not present.

**Logs, Images, Videos**

### Mindbender before Voidform
![log1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10604059/110562551-5c6be700-810f-11eb-890b-00001af22f48.png)
[Mindbender before Voidform](https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/4am8kJjM6nDFHh3L/#fight=1&type=damage-done&source=12&view=events)

In this log you can see this happening with both the melee swings and the Shadowflame Rift damage event.

First melee swing: 726
Melee swing after 3s: 762 (+5%)

First Shadowflame Rift: 2283
Second Shadowflame Rift: 2396 (+5%)
Note* on the second rift you can see the correct Hungering Void modifier is applied on Target 1, which is +15% from the first event (10 from HV + 5 from bug).

### Mindbender inside Voidform
![log2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10604059/110562563-6261c800-810f-11eb-8b16-42ea5cf2d945.png)
[Mindbender inside Voidform](https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/wvJhBTbz7RC38tAf/#fight=last&type=damage-done&source=10&view=events)

In this example I took my weapon off so the numbers are slightly different relative to log 1, but that isnt imortant here. You can clearly see that the melee swing damage remains constant at ~538. And the Shadowflame Rift damage sequence that matches log 1 is now correct. The only difference being we used Mindbender inside Voidform.

**Reproducible:**
Yes

**Howto:**
The following lists showcase this with just the melee swings, a more complex example can be seen by using the Shadowflame Prism legendary with Shadowflame Rift, but the bug is the same regardless.

### Bug sequence
1. Cast Mindbender
2. Cast Void Eruption
3. Notice melee swings are 5% lower than they should be for ~3seconds

### No Bug sequence
1. Cast Void Eruption
2. Cast Mindbender
3. Notice melee swings remain constant

title: Serrated Bone Spike Initial Hit not affected by Zoldyck Insignia (DoT portion is affected correctly)
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 PTR 37844

**Description:**
> Despite the initial hit being affected by Potent Assassin mastery of Assassination, the initial hit from SBS is not affected by Zoldyck Insignia. The DoT portion does get increased by 30% as expected.

**Reproducible:**
> Yes

**Howto:**
> Equip Zoldyck Insignia legendary in Assassination Spec. Observe damage of initial hit and DoT of SBS while an enemy is above and below 30% respectively.

title: Flagellation is using some builder and finisher interactions
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 PTR Build 37844

**Description:**
After removing Energy cost and CP generation from it it seems to have some leftover interactions of both builders and finishers.

- Flagellation does get the guaranteed critical strike from Symbols of Death Rank 2 on the instant damage. However, it does not consume the corresponding buff.
- ~~Flagellation is treated as a generator by Shadow Blades and the instant damage causes 50% additional shadow damage. However, it does not cause any combo point gains.~~
- Using Flagellation instant damage during Dreadblades does not generate any CP but instead seems to be treated as a finisher, causing a 5% HP drain on the player. Ouchie. Flagellation is what I'd like to call Schrödinger's Finisher now.

(Saw no issues with Broadside or Seal Fate.)

title: Virtuous Command isn't refreshed by additional Judgments
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 37474

**Description:**
If you already have a Virtuous Command buff active and cast Judgment, or Judgment is cast via Divine Toll, it won't refresh the buff.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
[warcraftlogs.com/reports/tTJ4WVGQdmKjhbMN#fight=last&type=auras&source=5&ability=339664](url)

**Reproducible:**
Yes

**Howto:**
Cast Judgment or Divine Toll with the buff already active.

title: Serrated Bone Spike CP inconsistent
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 PTR Build 37774

**Description:**
I can't quite say how to reproduce it but there seem to be random situations where Serrated Bone Spike gives only 1 CP when using it without any other spikes up. Other times, and as stated as intended in this [bluepost](https://us.forums.blizzard.com/en/wow/t//891465/17), it counts the current use spike and grants 2.

title: Invigorating Shadowdust removes 40 seconds from Dreadblades Cooldown (Outlaw Rogue Talent)
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 PTR Build 37774

**Description:**
> The Invigorating Shadowdust legendary is removing 40 seconds from the cooldown of the Dreadblades outlaw rogue talent, not 20 seconds as the legendary is intended to.

**Reproducible:**
> Yes

**Howto:**
> Equip a legendary item with Invigorating Shadowdust as the power on the 9.0.5 PTR. Cast Dreadblades on a target, and vanish. Observe cooldown dropping from 1:30 to 0:50

title: Minor Mutilate tooltip damage formula bug
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753

**Description:**
Mutilate tooltip uses a manually specified formula of `MHSpellDmg+OHSpellDmg*0.5` for the displayed damage value in spell data. However, the tooltip calculation already knows that the Off-Hand spell is dealing half damage so this manual halving halves it twice.

**Example:**

With my values in a test setup, I calculated for the individual spell data
Main Hand: 791
Off Hand: 395

Combined would be: `791+395=1186`
Instead, the tooltip does and shows: `791+395*0.5=989`

title: Sun King's Blessing does not trigger when a Hot Streak is spent on Flamestrike
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.5 PTR Build 37774

**Description:**
> The tooltip of the Sun King's Blessing legendary states that consuming Hot Streaks will cause the next non-instant Pyroblast to trigger Combustion. However, it only gains stacks when a Hot Streak is spent on Pyroblast.

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Equip the Sun King's Blessing legendary and spend a Hot Streak on Flamestrike.

title: Secret Technique does not stack Alacrity
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753

**Description:**
> Using Secret Technique does not trigger Alacrity.

title: Doomblade / Mutilated Flesh damage is using target modifiers from debuff amps
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753

**Description:**
> This is an issue that appeared in beta but was fixed towards the end of beta. However it appears to have resurfaced on live. Although the second Mutilate hit is refreshing the DoT, it is not dealing the correct amount of residual damage. This is causing the Legendary to deal significantly less damage than it is intended to.

**Details:**
> In the log below, the first hit is 679, the second is 328. This immediately pandemics up with a refresh visible in the logs. The DoT then ticks 3 times for 71 damage. The total DoT damage should be 302, but is only 213. It is not that it is totally ignoring the OH hit, as it triggers a refresh and OH crits are shown to bias the damage. However, it is somehow losing residual damage or a tick--perhaps due to the pandemic duration and odd tick rate.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/NHFz4RgYy9nBXMwK/#fight=1&type=damage-done&start=8799&end=143672&pins=0%24Separate%24%23244F4B%24auras-gained%241%240.0.0.Any%240.0.0.Any%24true%240.0.0.Any%24false%24340431%5E2%24Separate%24%23909049%24damage%240%240.0.0.Any%24188078822.0.0.Rogue%24true%240.0.0.Any%24false%245374%5E2%24Separate%24%23a04D8A%24damage%240%240.0.0.Any%24188078822.0.0.Rogue%24true%240.0.0.Any%24false%2427576%5E2%24Separate%24%23DF5353%24damage%240%240.0.0.Any%24188078822.0.0.Rogue%24true%240.0.0.Any%24false%24340431&source=7&view=events

**Reproducible:**
> 100%

title: Disciplinary Command can be triggered by background actions
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 37474

**Description:**
> The Mage legendary, Disciplinary Command, triggers its effect once the Mage casts an Arcane spell, a Fire spell, and a Frost spell within 10 seconds. Expected behavior is that this should only trigger when the Mage casts an active spell. In game, this is triggering from passive spells, including spells that operate in the background and are really just part of other spells.

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> * Talent into Flame Patch and cast a Flamestrike. Wait for just over 10 seconds and then cast a Frost spell and an Arcane spell. Disciplinary Command will trigger even though Flamestrike was cast over 10 seconds ago because the Flame Patch ticks are counting as Fire casts.
> * Select the Diverted Energy conduit and cast Blazing Barrier and Frost Nova. Next take damage from an enemy within 10 seconds. Disciplinary Command will trigger even though no Arcane spell was ever cast because Diverted Energy's healing procs are counting as Arcane casts.

title: Zoldyck Insignia and Potent Assassin Do Not Affect Sepsis Damage
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753

**Description:**
> Despite being pure Nature damage, Zoldyck does not affect the damage of Sepsis in-game. This is inconsistent with the fact that all other Nature damage for Assassination is affected, including Envenom's direct damage, as well as the fact that Shiv's poison damage buff affects Sepsis. The Sepsis debuff is also classified as a "Poison" in-game.

> Additionally, this is inconsistent with the fact that Serrated Bone Spike's DoT is affected by Zoldyck.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
Poison classification:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24741480/108464288-d6fec080-724d-11eb-9dc3-c74fb6e7ea6d.png)

Logs of it doing the same damage in execute vs. the middle of the fight:
https://www.warcraftlogs.com/reports/18Hfw3cvGkyQKB9h#fight=9&type=damage-done&source=15&ability=328305&view=events&targetbuffs=-79140.-319504

**Reproducible:**
> Yes

title: The impact of Phoenix Flames is sometimes delayed
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 37474

**Description:**
> Phoenix Flames sometimes has impact delays that can result in Phoenix Flames removing Heating Up unexpectedly.

**Details:**
> Normally when casting Fireball and Phoenix Flames at the same time, the damage event for Phoenix Flames reaches the client either at the same time as, or about 100 ms after the Fireball damage event. However, there is a specific distance window where the delay suddenly increases to somewhere between 400 ms and 500 ms. This window seems to occur somewhere around 16 - 18 yards; however, the window may be a function of model height because that affects spell travel time.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> Training Dummy (NPC ID: 174569) in Ardenweald - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e23cMb3GKaQ
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50294688/107850369-08dfd500-6dbf-11eb-9f7d-9c414f8e2767.png)

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Stand around 17 yards from the Training Dummy (NPC ID: 174569) in Ardenweald. Cast Fireball and queue Phoenix Flames so that they both cast at the same time. Phoenix Flames should have a much longer delay in its impact than when you do the same thing from most other ranges.

title: Arcane Momentum can cause Shimmer to cancel the Mage's casts
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753
> This bug has been around since at least early BFA, potentially since Shimmer was added.

**Description:**
> Shimmer can cause the Mage to appear a few units above the ground and then fall very briefly. If the player has enough world latency, the buff granted by Shimmer that allows spells to be cast while moving will not last long enough to prevent this tiny fall from canceling their cast.

> With Arcane Momentum, the buff that allows the player to cast while moving only lasts around 300 ms instead of 650 ms, which causes spells to cancel quite easily when Arcane Momentum is used.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> https://i.gyazo.com/47786bf5f96472c166b9845502a270e7.mp4

**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Enable Arcane Momentum, start casting a spell, and then use Shimmer. If the player's world latency is high enough, the cast will be canceled somewhat reliably.

title: Shiv does not work with Broadside
body:
**Game Version:**
> 9.0.2 live Build 36753

**Description:**
> Both the 20% increased damage as well as the extra Combo Point of Shiv does not work with Broadside.

**Details:**
> This makes it the only builder not working with Broadside. Also, Shiv does work with Shadowblades for Subtlety.

**Logs, Images, Videos**
> 

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/77858896/105577866-84c89d80-5d7c-11eb-9eda-17dbe0e43fa3.mp4



**Reproducible:**
> yes

**Howto:**
> Use Shiv while having the Broadside buff.

title: Grand Melee Grants Incorrect SnD Duration when Animacharged
